rComments: RIP my guy

This class was hard but prof Hofstra worked hard to make sure we understood the material. He was very patient and answered questions, was clear in his explanations and used resources to try and explain things in different ways. RIP
Great Prof, he made complex topics understandable and was always available after class for questions. Rest in peace.
Amazing Prof! May his soul rest in perfect Peace.

The material in this class is complicated but Professor Hofstra was always able to explain and give examples for questions asked in class. He was always available for office hours and and quickly responded to emails. You could tell he cared about his students and wanted everyone to succeed. Saddened to hear the loss of his passing. Rest in Peace.

I had the pleasure of having professor Hofstra for three out of my four semesters so far at the university. Professor Hofstra was an extremely caring man who truly wanted his students to succeed. He always conveyed the material with passion and excitement. I am deeply saddened to hear of his passing and I hope he rests in peace.

Saying you want your students to succeed is one thing, but backing that up with actions is another; professor Hofstra was always willing to go above and beyond to help his students succeed. 

He was the best math prof anyone could ask for.

Rest in peace Professor Hofstra.
Hofstra really did do everything he could to make linear algebra easy and approachable for students. It was a tragedy to lose him. Rest in peace.

Most brilliant and kind professor ever have, the lecture is well-organized and he always well prepared for every classes. I can't believe this is the last time I attend to your lecture. Rest in peace. Thank you for everything Dr. Pieter Hofstra

Probably one of the best teachers I have ever had.  I felt the urge to leave a rating not for prospective students, but because I was sad to hear he passed away.  He was the first professor that I genuinely wanted to take other courses he offered, and I wanted to get to know him better.  It is truly a tragedy to lose him.
Great guy and great teacher. Rest in peace  Professor Hofstra.

Pieter Hofstra was one of the best math teacher I've had. He was always there to answer your questions and he explained the material with ease. I now like linear algebra thanks to him. I was very sad when I was informed that he passed away. May he Rest In Peace.

Pieter was a phenomenal professor.  I re-took real analysis and was very happy to have had this professor. I believe this professor is one of the best in the math department. I would have recommended math and stats students to choose this professor however he has unexpectedly passed away.
It was a hard course but he was a really caring individual who genuinely wanted everyone to do well. I was very upset hearing he had passed away at the end of the course.

Take him! People complaining are people who didn't put in the work to do well. Quizzes every week, but my tip to you is to look at questions in his textbook (he has his own, no need to pay for one). He wants you to do well and is lenient about the weights of midterms and the exam. Failed my midterms but did very well on the exam and ended with an A

Prof. Hofstra is great at his job. He explains everything clearly and eloquently and is always available to help. The tests are easy if you read the course notes and do the assigned homework. Don't listen to people who say this course is hard. Try it for yourself. Have the right attitude. The negative people didn't very well.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: Great professor!  Lectures were easy to follow; he explains every topic clearly. He answers every question, and often stays after class to reexplain and clarify the material. Tests are fair, and he emphasizes on the important topics. You can tell he cares about his students and wants everyone to succeed. Best prof I've had so far!

Real analysis is a lot of work, but Hofstra really cares. I don't know of many profs who would spend 2 or 3 hours with me on a near weekly basis just going through examples and strategies to help me where I was lost. The midterms and final are direct applications of theorems. Overall you'd be lucky to have this guy as your analysis prof.
I dont like quizzes. He gives one every week. In most classes you either have quizzes or assignments in this class you have quizzes. Dont take this prof if you dislike quizzes. I hate quizzes

Awesome guy, super nice and explains things clearly. His quizzes are predictable as the questions are very similar to the assigned practice problems. No surprises on tests or anything like that. Also provides you w a textbook so you don't have to buy it for the course

Stunning lecturer with coherent explanations. Very accessible outside of class and helpful in one-on-one meetings. Difficult course but very possible to succeed by reading the textbook and going to office hours.

he cares about his students and isnt harsh. he gives bonus for participation which is really nice and really allows you to pick yourself back up from a bad grade. hes a gem and love his fibonacci shirt.

Linear algebra is the kind of course content-wise that can either click for a student or not at all. This my second time taking the course after dropping it last semester and Professor Hofstra has done a tremendous in conveying the material through his well-structured lecture slides and practice problems. He also gives bonus marks for participation

I can't even say if the course material is particularly hard or not because prof hofstra makes it so clear. He answers all questions and so you never feel weird asking. Lots of examples in class and very available outside of class. he's literally the best - great teacher and definitely cares how his students are doing. you can't go wrong with him

Best prof ever. Amazing lectures. He learns everyone's name and answers questions anytime. weekly take home quiz as a bonus grade. Not a super easy course in itself but he makes it easy and fun to grasp.

No attendance requirements for the lectures, but you have to be in the DGDs to write the quizzes. The workload wasn't much because there were no homework, it was more just about studying for the quizzes and tests on your own. Also, going to his office hours and getting help from the TA on a regular basis did boost my grade.

This course is not easy, probably this is the most difficult course for all first-year math students, but he makes t very easy to get into, he has his own way to teach this course, take note! you have to! he is an exceptional lecturer, if mat1362 is one of your mandatory course, then choose him

Such a kind and caring person. He really wants his students to do will and succeed. Hes willing to help his students in any way possible and is very accommodating. He knows his topic and posts all his slides. Theres a midterm and a final which are easy to study for using just his slides and previous tests he posts.

Hands down the best professor I've had in my 3 years at uOttawa, and he's inspired me to teach math. Dr. Hofstra made math not only interesting but super enjoyable, and I actively looked forward to going to his class. I would 100% recommend this to everyone.

The best prof I've had yet. His lectures and notes make proofs actually seem easy somehow and he is extremely open to questions during lectures. He spends the DGD answering individual questions instead of directed work which I found way better. Definitely take any classes that you can with him!!

I never knew math could be fun until I took professor Hofstra's class, Poker 101. He was very animated (yet precise) during his lectures, and his exams and quizzes reflected perfectly what we learned. He introduced us to many games and encouraged us to participate and attend each class. I highly recommend this class for a fun and easy elective!

This guy is a lot of fun and basically throws free marks at you. His quizzes are really hard at first, but by the final, i only had to answer 54/70 of the mc questions. Hardish class but he makes it really easy

This course isn't the easiest but he makes it seem easy and teaches it very well in a way almost anyone could understand. This course is extremely similar to MAT1362, but with a few additional topics.

Hofstra is probably the first professor I have had where he was not stumped once in the whole class. He knows everything about linear algebra and is confident about it. He explains things so well, and keeps everything straight forward.

Taught efficiently and in a way that kept the class interested and entertained. Doesn't use a textbook and his midterm and final are multiple choice and relatively easy short answer. Uses quizzes that give you a very good idea of the exact questions he'll use, and posts old midterms/finals. Marks attendance. Easy A+, fun subject. Also really cute.
Awesome prof, awesome guy, teaches well, not too strict, how much better can a professor get?

He posts all slides online after each lecture and the notes you need for the course. There is no textbook for this class and it is extremely easy. He also provides past year midterms that are very similar. You must attend approximately 80% of the classes in order to receive 10% attendance marks along with 10% for online quizzes.

Great course designed and taught by a great prof. Yes it's easy and kind of a bird course, but you also learn a lot and the subject matter is interesting. You can tell that he put a lot of work into this course and enjoys teaching it, anyone who's remotely interested in statistics, game theory, or just gambling should take it.
Great at explaining things and very helpful during office hours. Make sure you go to the class/dgds as he often gives hints as to which problems will be on the exams.

was very skeptical about taking this course with him but i must say am glad i did. His lectures were straight forward and the format he used was much easier than other profs(his test formats were different from the conventional linear test), would advice who take him because you wont  regret it, you just need to work hard and your sure to pass

Hofstra was a great and hilarious lecturer but prepared to take lots and lots of notes. He writes on the blackboard so it's fairly easy to follow along. His exams are literal reworks of the past ones so it is very easy to do well.
the birdiness course ever!

Hofstra is an amazing prof! He does many examples in class which makes you understand the concept better. He is a very good lecturer and I never got bored in his class. Even though the midterm average for class was low, he made up for it by giving an easy final. He provides example midtermsexams so make sure to study those and you will do fine
Amazing prof. Everyone failed the midterm but he still helped us a lot and made us all pass the course! Amazing prof and the best one for math.
Notes are really helpful, super awesome that  he doesn't make you buy a text book. Such a nice prof and sooo good looking...

God bless this man. Excellent lecturer. Material is tough and abstract but he makes it easy to understand. 50% final and 5 tests throughout the semester. Tests you on what he teaches. Don't fall behind and you'll survive.

Hofstra is amazing! He's very clear in his explanations, and encourages his students to ask questions if they aren't following his lectures. He gives a test about every 2 weeks, but it forces you to keep up with the material. You'll have minimal studying to do for the final because you've been keeping up with everything all semester.

The class is one of the best math classes (should be moved to first year and mandatory for math, physics, and CS). Hofstra is a great professor and he is really good at helping. His lectures are crystal clear but nothing too special. Assignments are fairly difficult at first but if you do all the exercises from the book, you will pass for sure.
Course content seems easy until you see assignments, midterms and final. He's very nice and approachable.
All lectures are online, so if you miss a lecture you can catch up easily. He is amazing at explaining math and cares about students. If you ask a question in lecture he will answer you clearly

There are 5 midterms in this class. So basically, you go to a DGD and the next week's a midterm and the trend carries on. It was really hard for me at the beginning but then the course gets easier and easier as you get used to it. Definitely take it with this guy, HE KNOWS HIS STUFF AND TELLS YOU WHAT TO STUDY. Past exams are very useful!

There's tests every two weeks, but he prepares you well for them, do the previous exam and midterm questions he assigns and if you have time, do the stuff from the book too. I found he was my best prof first semester, learned a lot from him and he made a big class feel a lot smaller, also he's got a pretty good sense of humour.

The course materials are pretty similar to the ones you learns from MAT1341(discrete mathatics).  However, he doesn't give partial points and the assignments are a bit confusing even if you went to all the lectures. He is a nice guy though. He's always there to answer your questions.

Good prof. I hated the subject but this prof explained things very clearly. DGDs were a waste of time though and the TA was bad. The midterms were unfortunately on the weekend and the first midterm average was quite low but things improved significantly for everyone after that. The final was not difficult either.

The poker course that is given by Prof. Hofstra is probably the best course I've taken my whole undergrad. He is fair, stimulating, and genuinely likes what he teaches (Which makes it so much easier to learn) Take notes, listen, and understand the concepts for an easy A+. His online quizzes reflect the exams perfectly. No surprises!

Great prof, many say its a difficult course, but he does a good job conveying material and he posts notes and solutions on his website. He is also available for office hours and he encourages you to come ask questions and review midterms and assignments.
Exams and online tests are extremely fair. Learn the slideshows, and you will do really well.

This is a great class with a great professor that stimulates interest. The professor really knows what he's teaching and is really interesting to listen to. It's great to learn a concrete method of solving probability problems related to games. Tests were fair and they reflected the teaching material and assignments. Great class, bravo!
Best notes, lots of examples and fair tests. Easily the best prof I've had in first year eng.
Best prof ever only downside is that he doesn't teach every course i have to take which is very unfortunate!
Best math prof I have had so far
MAT1341-->clear notes and explains theorems with clarity and provides lots of examples.

He taught Foundations of Mathematics very well. He wrote up several documents with additional exercises that supplemented the lectures perfectly. The final exam was a mixture of questions that should have been no surprise to anyone who did enough work. Always available through email or during office hours to help. I would take another course w him.

I had him 2 years in a row, once for Poker 101 and this time for Foundations. He's a very good prof who can teach very well, and he's very easy to reach outside of class. My only complaint is that he marks ridiculously hard...in fact, it's really, really hard to get any part marks from him. Maybe it's just 2362, but screwing 1 thing up = zero...
Do not take the course from him

Had him for an elective math class about poker and game theory - obviously a hobby of his, he made the class a lot of fun!  He also sounds a bit like a Muppet, which just makes the lectures more engaging (or maybe just in my head).  He played online poker for the class, that was pretty entertaining.  Hard quizzes, but good class overall.

Good prof. All the notes were posted online. Very nice guy, answered any questions students had. Midterms and exam might be hard but you can do really well on them if you do the homework. Homework is the key to success in any math class.

All of his content was online, which was helpful in the event of a missed class. Only midterms, no homework. Nothing is written on the board! Everything is on slides, so it can be difficult to follow. Difficult exams, but very approachable.
Hofstra is a great teacher. Conveys the material well and always ends class early! However, his tests are pretty hard; he makes everything seem so easy though in his notes! Beware

He is an excellent supportive teacher. His explanation is clear and organized. U could even meet him outside his office hours. The HW  and exams were a bit hard but if u attend all the lectures and DGD's and u solved all the assignments and the practice problems he posts, u could easily get a good grade.

Explains his concepts very well and is easy to understand. Uses the blackboard, so annotates and draws visual aids when needed. Little mandatory homework but the course content is challenging, so do the practice questions. He's a very good teacher, but it's up to you to master the material. Exams test applied knowledge; study and you'll be fine.
A good prof with clear explanations and expectations.
nice accent, tidbit boring, friendly, the course itself is pretty rough, he did a fair job teaching it
Well, I think he is a good professor, but the course is hard. Or maybe it's not the course, but the TESTS !
He's kinda boring but I guess math is just boring overall.
He makes the course easier for me to understand,all the problems are displayed steps by steps.
Excellent professor.  Clear, to the point and explains how to solve the problems step by step.
Super guy, explained everything twice, if needed.  Killer accent too, Dutch people are awesome.
hes awesome!!! plus hes cute, not really ..but ya
Dutch - nice accent.  The course is dry, but he's fairly clear and helpful.  Assignments tricky, midterm not bad.
